SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc19
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.View.ClientController

Class ClientController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.View.ClientController.ClientController
public class ClientController extends Object
The class is used to forward the actions given by the user to the client network interface. The class can permit different action based on the state of the client, that vary when certain actions are done or when certain messages are received. It contains a method to parse a string and various states that can elaborate the action.

  • Field Details

    • nickname

      private String nickname
      Nickname of the player

    • viewState

      private ClientState viewState
      The attribute represent the current state of the client. Depending on its value only certain actions can be performed.

    • prevState

      private ClientState prevState
      The attribute represent the previous state of the client. Used to retrieve the old state after an action is refused, the game is no more in PAUSE, ...

    • localModel

      private LocalModel localModel
      LocalModel connected to the controller

      ClientInterface connected to the controller

      UI connected to the controller

    • signalPossibleNetworkProblem

      public void signalPossibleNetworkProblem()
      The method should be called when the client detects a disconnection. The client state is changed in Disconnect and a new thread tries to reconnect the client sending requests at a fixed rate.

    • setLocalModel

      public void setLocalModel(LocalModel localModel)
      Setter for localModel
      Parameters:
      localModel - the LocalModel to be set

      public boolean isDisconnected()
      Checks if client is disconnected (e.g. its viewState is ViewState.DISCONNECT).
      Returns:
      true if client is disconnected

    • placeCard

      public boolean placeCard(String cardToInsert, String anchor, Direction direction, CardOrientation cardOrientation)
      To place a card given its anchor, the direction and the orientation. place_card(cardToInsert, anchorCard, directionToInsert, cardOrientation)
      Parameters:
      cardToInsert - the code of the card to insert
      anchor - the code of the PlayableCard used as anchor
      direction - the Direction in which card has to be placed
      cardOrientation - the CardOrientation of the placed card
      Returns:
      true if and only if card can be placed (locally).

    • chooseGoal

      public void chooseGoal(int cardIdx)
      To choose a goal card at the beginning of the game. There should two cards to select from so the user should give a number representing the selected card. choose_goal(goalCardIndex)
      Parameters:
      cardIdx - the index (0 or 1) of the chosen GoalCard

    • placeInitialCard

      public void placeInitialCard(CardOrientation cardOrientation)
      To place the initial card at the beginning of the game vien its orientation. place_initial_card(orientation)
      Parameters:
      cardOrientation - the CardOrientation in which initial card has to be placed

      To notify the server that the player want to join the first available fame. join_first_game()

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(String gameName)
      To notify the server that the player want to join a particular game. join_game(gameName)
      Parameters:
      gameName - the name of the game to join

    • createGame

      public void createGame(String gameName, int numPlayers)
      To create a game specifying the game name and the number of players. create_game(gameName, numPlayers)
      Parameters:
      gameName - the name of the game to build
      numPlayers - the number of players for the game

    • logoutFromGame

      public void logoutFromGame()
      Used to log out from game. It sets viewState to ViewState.NOT_GAME and tries to send, throughout clientNetwork, a RequestGameExitMessage. Sets localModel to null also for connected UIs.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Used to disconnect from server.

    • availableColors

      public void availableColors()
      This method handles available colors requests from user.
